I = \int f(x) \cdot g(x) \, dx = -x \sin x + \cos x + C
step.reason: \begin{align} I &= \int f(x) \cdot g(x) \, dx \\ &= f(x) \int \, dx - \int \left[ f'(x) \cdot \int g(x) \, dx \right] \, dx \\ \implies I &= x \int \sin x \, dx - \int \left[ \dfrac{d}{dx} x \cdot \int \sin x \, dx \right] \, dx\\ &= x \int \sin x \, dx + \int \cos x \, dx \\ &= -x \cos x + \sin x + C \end{align}
